postsData.name:
Mark R. Koesterer
Mark R. Koesterer
postsData.content:
Day 23 The Rocky Steps Challenge, Unlocking Influence

Do you pour your heart and soul into creating amazing content, only to have it fall flat?

You're not alone!
At, we believe every content piece deserves an audience. That's why we're diving deep into the art of the "hook" ‚Äì the captivating opening that grabs attention and reels your audience in.

Today's leadership lesson unveils 18 powerful hooks to supercharge your social media engagement.

Think of it as the first impression that makes or breaks your connection. A strong hook:
* Sparks curiosity: "You won't BELIEVE what happened..."
* Creates intrigue: "I have a confession to make..."
* Drives urgency: "Limited time offer!..."
* Builds anticipation: "Get ready to be amazed..."

By mastering the art of the hook, you can:
* Increase your visibility: Stand out from the noise and get noticed.
* Boost engagement: Drive likes, comments, and shares.
* Grow your audience: Attract new followers who are eager to hear more.
* Build relationships: Connect with your audience on a deeper level.

Ready to unlock the power of the hook? Let's climb those Rocky Steps together!




You can hear my thoughts HERE:
postsData.commentAdded: Love this focus on hooks! üé£ A great reminder that the first impression can make all the difference in connecting with our audience. Lets elevate our content!

postsData.name:
G. Brent Barkin
G. Brent Barkin
postsData.content:
Continuing our 2025 post series with number 8.

Some of the PlayBooked team, Chloe V. Mitchell, Patrick Werksma, and I had productive conversations regarding the impact of the Department of Education's recent statement on NIL and Title IX ("Title 9" for those who skipped the roman numeral day in middle school).

Parts of my post may be repetitive, be patient with me while I work out the true implications of attempting to write a series. Yes I know we aren't on the 8th day of the year. I will have to play some catch up at some point.

has cleared the path for Universities to pay NIL money directly to athletes. Much simpler, right? While collectives certainly have a place in acting as fan clubs and co-ordinating crowd-sourced donor-dollars to athletes and sourcing marketing deals, in some situations they have been a work-around for
dollars. But that has changed, and schools, as long as the dollars can be justified (i.e. pay for marketing and not performance) can now pay athletes directly. And now...

THEY HAVE TO PAY FEMALE ATHLETES THE SAME AMOUNT. That's in the aggregate. Ifwants to give male football players and basketball players a combined $10M- yes that's a 10 with six zeros after it--they have to do the same for female athletes at their school.

It's a massive and fundamental change, but that's Title IX folks. The actual wording: ‚ÄúNo person in the United States shall, on the basis of sex, be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be subjected to discrimination under any education program or activity receiving Federal financial assistance.‚Äù

So now what? Since nearly all of these schools receive Federal financial assistance in some form they all must comply. And now they must do so with their NIL dollars.

Do schools cut non-revenue generating programs? Well if they do, they must do so for both male and female teams, but then, wait for it....that will work against them, since they will be dumping the same massive dollars into non revenue-generating female sports as they would the male revenue-generating sports! It be nearly impossible for a top tier school to efficiently use the same dollars to recruit a handful of women's athletes to their school. There will indeed be an arms race for top tier female talent in basketball, since it does generate revenue in many schools, but for the rest of the money, there is a conundrum- how to spend it?

Or see this as a unique opportunity.

Elevate all of your women's teams. Push a disproportionate size of your NIL funds to a couple teams, then direct the rest for the betterment of all of your female athletes. What could tens of thousands of $ do to members of the track team, soccer team, lacrosse team who could focus on school and sports instead of an outside job? Matriculation rates rise, less students transfer, happy graduates, happy (eventual) donors.

Or stop taking all federal money.

comments.commentText:
Keep posting Brent!

i read all these posts, because they help me think about, and see different angles on NIL $$ implications. Nicely written.

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting insights on Title IXs impact on NIL! This is a pivotal moment for equity in sports. Looking forward to seeing how universities adapt!

postsData.content:
How scheduled tasks are transforming client project management at Mchange.pl

Managing client projects isn‚Äôt just about staying organized,it‚Äôs about addressing the deeper challenges that drive success. At, we‚Äôre taking project management to the next level with AI-powered tools like ChatGPT‚Äôs Scheduled Tasks. Here‚Äôs how we‚Äôre creating real impact for our clients:

 Never miss a milestone. Deadlines matter, but key milestones are where success is built. We use scheduled reminders to track critical tasks, ensuring nothing slips through the cracks.
Example: ‚ÄúRemind me 3 days before the delivery date of theTransformation project to check on progress.‚Äù

 Listening to clients, always. Client feedback drives improvement. That‚Äôs why we schedule follow-ups after each project phase to gather insights and ensure satisfaction.
Example:‚ÄúRemind me to send a feedback request after completing a phase of theAI Adoption project.‚Äù

 Strategic alignment, every Step. Client goals evolve, and we make sure our projects keep pace. Quarterly reminders help us assess alignment with their long-term objectives.
Example:‚ÄúSet quarterly reminders to review how our ongoing projects align withstrategic goals.‚Äù

 Proactive communication. Keeping clients informed is key. We automate reminders for monthly progress updates, so clients always know where their projects stand.
Example:‚ÄúRemind me to send monthly progress reports to Mchange on the ongoing digital transformation project.‚Äù

‚≠ê Ensuring post-project Satisfaction. Our commitment doesn‚Äôt end at delivery. We schedule post-project reviews to evaluate outcomes and gather valuable feedback.
Example:‚ÄúSet a reminder to schedule a post-project review meeting with Mchange two weeks after the project is delivered.‚Äù

 Ongoing training & support. For clients with training or support needs, we use reminders to follow up consistently, ensuring they‚Äôre always equipped to succeed.
Example: ‚ÄúRemind me quarterly to check in with Mchange for training updates on their new platform.‚Äù

 At, we believe AI isn‚Äôt just about technology, it‚Äôs about transforming workflows, solving real pain points, and driving client success. If your projects aren‚Äôt reaching their full potential, let‚Äôs change that.

Ô∏è Talk to your clients to uncover their true frustrations.
Ô∏è Use AI to tackle deeper challenges.
Ô∏è Update your workflows to reflect real transformation.

Ready to transform your client interactions? Visit us ator reach out today.

comments.commentText: The ability to continuously align projects with evolving client goals through scheduled reviews is a strong example of how AI can support long-term success.
Nerea Arregui Exposito AI makes it so much easier to stay proactive and responsive to evolving client needs.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Leveraging AI for proactive project management is a game changer. Excited to see Mchange.pl lead the way in client satisfaction! üöÄ

postsData.content:
JUST IN: The ransomware group INC RANSOM has claimed responsibility for breaching Stark Aerospace, a prominent US-based defense and space company. 
According to the threat actor‚Äôs statement, 4 TB of sensitive company data has been stolen and is being auctioned on their dark web portal. (via Dark Web Informer)

Compromised Data Includes:
- Design documentation.
- Source code for software environments, including UAV firmware.
- Personal data of instructors (passport copies and training logs).
- Contractual information with military contractors and the US Department of Defense.
- Details on reconnaissance satellite production programs.
- Virtual machines of laboratories and information security configurations.

Evidence Provided:
Threat actor shared screenshots of confidential documents, technical drawings, and operational blueprints.

comments.commentText: So, they decided to not pay??
Da wundert man sich, eine Firma im Bereich Verteidigung und keine hinreichende IT-Sicherheit.

postsData.commentAdded: This breach highlights the critical need for robust cybersecurity measures in the defense sector. Protecting sensitive data must be a top priority!

postsData.name:
Priyank Ahuja
Priyank Ahuja
postsData.content:
Language is the foundation of communication - it connects us in countless ways.
It can be verbal, non-verbal, written, or visual.

Think about it: speaking in your native tongue with family, sharing a special handshake with a friend, or using a secret code with your partner to escape a boring party. These are all ways we find comfort in our preferred language.

For many Indians, this comfort lies in regional languages. This is especially true for older generations who may not be as proficient in multiple languages as their younger counterparts. For instance, my 8-year-old nephew is more fluent in English than I was at his age - and perhaps even more than I am now!

That‚Äôs why I was pleasantly surprised by‚Äôs launch of a multilingual dashboard for their Rizta Z vehicle. Supporting eight regional languages, this thoughtful update shows how the brand understands the importance of personalization through language.

Kudos to the product and marketing teams for this incredible feature rollout, timed perfectly for Republic Day! üáÆüá≥

comments.commentText: It‚Äôs true‚Äîlanguage is more than just a tool for communication; it‚Äôs a bridge to connection, culture, and comfort. From secret codes to shared dialects, it shapes our relationships and how we experience the world.
Embracing regional languages not only enhances user experience but also fosters inclusivity and ensures that technology is accessible to all.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely love this initiative! Language truly bridges gaps, and its wonderful to see brands embracing regional diversity. Kudos to the team! üåü

postsData.name:
Neil Sahota
Neil Sahota
postsData.content:
The role of artificial intelligence (AI) in business is becoming a driving force behind major transformations across industries. AI is no longer just a buzzword, but a vital tool that enhances operational efficiency, streamlines processes, and improves customer experiences. From automating repetitive tasks to providing deeper insights through data analysis, AI is reshaping how businesses operate and deliver value to their customers.

With AI's ability to adapt and learn, businesses can now make smarter decisions faster, reduce human error, and uncover opportunities that may have previously gone unnoticed. By integrating AI into various sectors such as finance, healthcare, and marketing, companies are gaining a competitive edge, improving their bottom lines, and staying ahead of market trends. The real potential of AI lies in its capacity to assist business leaders in making informed choices based on accurate, real-time data.

As AI continues to be integrated into business operations, its potential to reshape industries becomes more evident. With the right strategies and technologies in place, AI offers a pathway to long-term growth and innovation. Embracing AI today means positioning for a future where technology plays a key role in business success.

To watch the entire Human-AI Symbiosis with  Cedric Chin and Lia DiBello Ph.D on the Commoncog podcast, click here -

comments.commentText: Great observation about AI reducing repetitive tasks.

postsData.commentAdded: AI is indeed revolutionizing business strategies! Excited to see how organizations leverage its potential for growth and innovation. #FutureOfWork

postsData.name:
Anthony Wentzel
Anthony Wentzel
postsData.content:
Ready to make your app available to users on the App Store?

Here's a guide for you to follow to make sure your app is up and running in no time. 

üü° Step 1: App Store Categories and App Store Information

Provide relevant App Store information.

-The name and description of your app.
-The primary category your app belongs to.
-Supported languages, customer ratings, customer reviews, etc.

Choose your App Store categories wisely!

üü° Step 2: Register your Developer Account

You'll need to have a registered account.

It will have the tools you need to prepare and submit your app.

üü° Step 3: Set up Development Tools

Set up a development environment.

Install Xcode, the official Apple development tools, and other necessary software.

üü° Step 4: Write a Comprehensive Description:

Write an engaging and informative description.

It provides customers with an in-depth look at what your app does and why it should be downloaded.

üü° Step 5: Prepare Your App for Submission

Complete the technical preparations for submission.

Assemble your App Store screenshots, logo, videos, app assets, etc.

These give customers a visual impression of the app‚Äôs features, making them a crucial element.

Then complete the App Store build, including any required code and configuration.

üü° Step 6: Receive App Store Approval

The review process for the App Store review team takes anywhere between 1‚Äì2 weeks.

Once the review team approves, you'll receive a notification, and your app will be eligible for download.

üü° Step 7: Submit Apple Metadata and Link App to App Store

Submit your Apple Metadata to the App Store.

Audio and video files, PDFs, and images, along with the link to your app.

The App Store team will notify you that your app is ready to go live.


üü° Step 8: Monitor Feedback and Make Updates

Once your app has been released, customers may provide feedback through the App Store, email, or other channels.

Monitor this feedback and make necessary updates to the app.

üü° Submitting your app to the App Store

You'll need an Apple Developer account and access to a Mac computer.

First, create an iTunes Connect account to submit your app and manage its information.

Then you can use Xcode to upload your app‚Äôs binary file to the App Store.

You‚Äôll also need to provide some basic information about your app, such as its name, description, and category.

After Apple approves, it will be available for download on the App Store.

As long as you are willing to put in some hard work and dedication, there is no doubt that you will find success when attempting to launch your own iOS application.

Good luck!
postsData.commentAdded: Great breakdown! Following these steps will definitely make the app submission process smoother. Excited to see everyones apps on the App Store! üöÄüì±

postsData.name:
Roger Wade
Roger Wade
postsData.content:
I‚Äôm increasingly frustrated by entrepreneurs who continually criticise the UK. Let‚Äôs set the record straight:

Taxation: Claims of ‚Äúsuper high taxes that crush growth‚Äù are unfounded. The UK‚Äôs tax revenue is below the average of other developed G7 economies.

Bureaucracy: The notion that ‚Äúbureaucracy and regulations strangle any innovative ideas‚Äù is wrong. The UK government has implemented measures to reduce unnecessary bureaucracy and support business innovation.

Attitude Towards Wealth: If you feel that there‚Äôs ‚Äúa culture that sees wealth as something to apologise for,‚Äù perhaps it‚Äôs time to reassess your social circle.

I‚Äôve successfully run businesses in the UK for over 35 years. Initiatives like the Enterprise Investment Scheme (EIS) make it one of the most attractive environments for entrepreneurs.

Frankly, too many so-called entrepreneurs are unwilling to put in the hard work required for success. They prefer flaunting images of private jets, luxury cars, and yachts rather than rolling up their sleeves.

The Labour government has been in power for less than 200 days and is addressing a ¬£22 billion tax deficit left by the previous Tory administration, which orchestrated one of the most significant acts of economic self-harm in modern history: Brexit.

It‚Äôs high time we focus on the opportunities and strengths within the UK rather than perpetually seeking excuses.

comments.commentText: London is possibly the best city in the world. But the UK is not a great place to do business generally. Yes, taxes alone are deadly

postsData.commentAdded: Great points! It‚Äôs crucial to focus on the UK‚Äôs strengths and opportunities. Let‚Äôs celebrate the entrepreneurial spirit instead of critiquing it!

postsData.content:
I'm not for everyone 

but clearly, I have a 'type' 

And while much of my "Market-Yourself-As-You-Would-Your-Product-To-Get-The-Job-You-Want," that I teach MAY apply to everyone...

My first love is medical sales
and here's why:

You should only COACH on what you know from many angles and real experience.

There.
I said it.

So for those who want MY comeback-so-strong-in-medical-sales-or-after-a-layoff-your-buddies-ask-where-you'd-been-storing-all-that-swagger SYSTEM for:

1// Surviving 5x layoffs and bouncing back fast (AND NOT with 'self care' as your first stop)

2// Becoming the Internal Referral at a Dream Company even when you're 'outside industry'

3// What 16,000 Medical Sales Resumes proved MUST be on your resume to sell you on paper

 This ain't my first rodeo 

I've been in this for DECADES as:

1// Ex-Pharma Head Hunter

2// Former Medical Sales Professional (*ahem* oncology physician liaison, etc. Ô∏è)

3// Award Winning Resume Writer (and my team are, too!)

4// Cum Laude Marketing and Advertising Grad from THE best journalism school -- E.W.Scripps at @Ohio University (Go Cats!)

5// 5-Time-Layoff-Bouncer-Backer

...6// And NOW I'm IN the hiring seat (cue Lion King's "Circle of Life")

______________________

What I'm saying is, I've got you C-O-V-E-R-E-D from all sides

...like your scrub tech buddy who texts you the surgery schedule, morning-of...

...or the Starbucks barista who keeps a list of the 'usual order' from your top referring office

...like the angel on your shoulder...

______________________

That way, when you spent all morning stocking fridges with 'kits' and are waiting for that case to start but last week your boss whispered the outcomes data didn't look good so you see the writing on the wall...

you've got a lever to pull.

.me.

And, I'm saying "It's going to be okay. This isn't the end of you. Let's keep movin'."

______________________

Hi, I'm Claire M Davis.

And after 16,000 Medical Sales Resumes, riding 5X layoffs in the medical sales industry, and helping 105 of 110 clients land roles last year -- I'm feeling pretty solid that I can sort out your complicated career story for you.

I've heard it all. Trust me.

So if you're looking to...Get In...Get Back In...Stay In...Medical Sales -- and you need a hand, send me a DM.

I'm ready to make this a whole lot easier on you.

postsData.name:
Leslie Venetz
Leslie Venetz
postsData.content:
This deceptive sales practice has to stop. 


Booking time on a prospect's calendar without their permission seems to be making a comeback.

Maybe it was just the end-of-the-year Hail Marys, but I'm hearing a lot more leaders getting calendar darts and even saw a few LinkedIn posts recommending it as a strategy.

I got a few myself.

I cancel every single one and usually report as SPAM + block the email.

I am 10000% certain we can be successful as sellers without lying, cheating, manipulating, and bribing our buyers.


 What do you think of this technique?

comments.commentText: So does that mean you don't want to chat on January 28th at 8am PST?
Grey Newell make it 6am and we have a deal
Leslie Venetz bet!

I agree with you but part of the problem is many people are putting their calendar links to book a meeting on their LinkedIn pages or websites. Although I would never do this, I can see how some people see interpret this as an invitation to book a meeting.

Christopher (Chris) Kelly THATS the broader conversation that I think needs to happen. 

I don‚Äôt think sellers are doing this because they are all lazy and dishonest. 

I think this behavior is driven by insane pressure and unrealistic expectations from their leaders.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Ethical selling builds trust and long-term relationships. Lets champion integrity in our sales practices!
